meanings.definition: Not holding one's attention; boring or uninteresting.
meanings.sent1: The movie was so unriveting that I fell asleep halfway through.
meanings.sent2: The lecture was unriveting, and many students struggled to stay awake.
meanings.sent3: The unriveting book made a great bedtime story for insomniacs.
meanings.sent4: The unriveting landscape stretched endlessly, devoid of any charm.
meanings.sent5: The unriveting presentation left the audience yawning and checking their phones.

meanings.sent1: Her unriveting speech failed to inspire any enthusiasm in the crowd.
meanings.sent2: The play's unriveting plot left the audience feeling disappointed.
meanings.sent3: The unriveting magic show made the children giggle at the magician's failed tricks.
meanings.sent4: The unriveting sunset lacked the vibrant colors that usually captivated onlookers.
meanings.sent5: The unriveting conversation at the party quickly died down as people lost interest.
